Montessori Open

Conference Next Coffee Conversation

Who are we?

My name is Karissa Lightsmith. In 2010, I started Lighthouse Montessori and this is my next step.

Montessori is an oral tradition and must keep growing if it is to flourish. So let’s get together and share what we do!

Stuff…

But I can’t do this alone! My role is almost more coordination than anything else. It’s local Montessorians and schools that have the bulk of the work. If you’re passionate about this and want to help, please let me know!!!

Conference

We all know that the best part of conferences are the breaks, when you get to talk to your friends about stories, problems, and joys. This conference is designed to be 2 full days of just that!

How will it work?

We’ll be using Open Space Technology to hold this conference. What does that look like?

First we’ll get together in a circle and people (that’s you) will announce the sessions you would like to hold over the time we are together. We’ll post all those sessions to a giant wall which will serve as our “marketplace” of ideas. Then you get to spend the rest of the conference going back and forth between way too many great sessions.

Coffee Conversations

We want to create a more cohesive Montessori community here in the Northwest. To that end, we’ll be holding “coffee conversations” in both Seattle and Portland, leadingn up to our conference.

Upcoming coffees

Jan 2015 Seattle, Greenwood Chocolati, ... RSVP
Feb 2015 Portland, TBA
March 2015 Seattle, TBA
April 2015 Seattle, TBA
April 2015 Portland, TBA

How will it work?

We’ll be using a discussion format called Lean Coffee. It’s an easy way to have a structured conversation. We think it will give you an idea of what will be possible in the conference and help us all to get to know each other better.

  1. Write your idea on a post-it

    Everyone writes Montessori topics + questions on post-its. You might ask "How do you manage transitions?" or "How do you handle conflict in the classroom?".

  2. Vote for your favorite ideas

    Quickly, everyone will put a dot on the post-its that they would like to talk about. Ideas then get sorted by how many dots they have.

  3. Learn and share!

    Talk about what's important. Each idea gets 8 minutes, and then a quick check to see if we should spend more time or move to the next idea.

Connect Online

Why wait for the conference? Join the google group or facebook group to be part of the conversation starting now!

Questions, ideas, suggestions? Reach me at karissa@lighthousemontessori.com or 801-717-0500.
